verses.plain: Israel is an empty vine, he bringeth forth fruit unto himself: according to the multitude of his fruit he hath increased the altars; according to the goodness of his land they have made goodly images.

tokens.t: Israel
an empty vine, he bringeth forth fruit unto himself: according to the multitude of his fruit he hath increased the altars; according to the goodness of his land they have made goodly images.

verses.plain: Their heart is divided; now shall they be found faulty: he shall break down their altars, he shall spoil their images.

tokens.t: Their heart is divided; now shall they be found faulty: he shall break down their altars, he shall spoil their images.

verses.plain: For now they shall say, We have no king, because we feared not the LORD; what then should a king do to us?

tokens.t: For now they shall say, We have no king, because we feared not the
; what then should a king do to us?

verses.plain: They have spoken words, swearing falsely in making a covenant: thus judgment springeth up as hemlock in the furrows of the field.

tokens.t: They have spoken words, swearing falsely in making a covenant: thus judgment springeth up as hemlock in the furrows of the field.

verses.plain: The inhabitants of Samaria shall fear because of the calves of Beth-aven: for the people thereof shall mourn over it, and the priests thereof that rejoiced on it, for the glory thereof, because it is departed from it.

tokens.t: The inhabitants of Samaria shall fear because of the calves of Beth-aven: for the people thereof shall mourn over it, and the priests thereof
rejoiced on it, for the glory thereof, because it is departed from it.

verses.plain: It shall be also carried unto Assyria for a present to king Jareb: Ephraim shall receive shame, and Israel shall be ashamed of his own counsel.

tokens.t: It shall be also carried unto Assyria
a present to king Jareb: Ephraim shall receive shame, and Israel shall be ashamed of his own counsel.

verses.plain: As for Samaria, her king is cut off as the foam upon the water.

tokens.t: Samaria, her king is cut off as the foam upon the water.

verses.plain: The high places also of Aven, the sin of Israel, shall be destroyed: the thorn and the thistle shall come up on their altars; and they shall say to the mountains, Cover us; and to the hills, Fall on us.

tokens.t: The high places also of Aven, the sin of Israel, shall be destroyed: the thorn and the thistle shall come up on their altars; and they shall say to the mountains, Cover us; and to the hills, Fall on us.

verses.plain: O Israel, thou hast sinned from the days of Gibeah: there they stood: the battle in Gibeah against the children of iniquity did not overtake them.

tokens.t: O Israel, thou hast sinned from the days of Gibeah: there they stood: the battle in Gibeah against the children of iniquity did not overtake them.

verses.plain: It is in my desire that I should chastise them; and the people shall be gathered against them, when they shall bind themselves in their two furrows.

tokens.t: in my desire that I should chastise them; and the people shall be gathered against them, when they shall bind themselves in their two furrows.

verses.plain: And Ephraim is as an heifer that is taught, and loveth to tread out the corn; but I passed over upon her fair neck: I will make Ephraim to ride; Judah shall plow, and Jacob shall break his clods.

tokens.t: And Ephraim
an heifer
taught,
loveth to tread out
but I passed over upon her fair neck: I will make Ephraim to ride; Judah shall plow,
Jacob shall break his clods.

verses.plain: Sow to yourselves in righteousness, reap in mercy; break up your fallow ground: for it is time to seek the LORD, till he come and rain righteousness upon you.

tokens.t: Sow to yourselves in righteousness, reap in mercy; break up your fallow ground: for
time to seek the
, till he come and rain righteousness upon you.

verses.plain: Ye have plowed wickedness, ye have reaped iniquity; ye have eaten the fruit of lies: because thou didst trust in thy way, in the multitude of thy mighty men.

tokens.t: Ye have plowed wickedness, ye have reaped iniquity; ye have eaten the fruit of lies: because thou didst trust in thy way, in the multitude of thy mighty men.

verses.plain: Therefore shall a tumult arise among thy people, and all thy fortresses shall be spoiled, as Shalman spoiled Beth-arbel in the day of battle: the mother was dashed in pieces upon her children.

tokens.t: Therefore shall a tumult arise among thy people, and all thy fortresses shall be spoiled, as Shalman spoiled Beth-arbel in the day of battle: the mother was dashed in pieces upon
children.

verses.plain: So shall Beth-el do unto you because of your great wickedness: in a morning shall the king of Israel utterly be cut off.

tokens.t: So shall Beth-el do unto you because of your great wickedness: in a morning shall the king of Israel utterly be cut off.

footnotes.text: an…: or, a vine emptying the fruit which it giveth
images: Heb. statues, or, standing images
Their heart…: or, He hath divided their heart
images: Heb. statues, or, standing images
the water: Heb. the face of the water
when…: or, when I shall bind them for their two transgressions, or, in their two habitations
her…: Heb. the beauty of her neck
your…: Heb. the evil of your evil
